result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn T Strahota was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn T Strahota

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: dated November 7, 2016, from Agent Pulice re: all conditions satisfied, including all costs paid
Probation review hearing on November 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations -6 months (12/03/2016)

1:15 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Bret Grant present in court. Court goes over monies owed on both cases.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Court makes statement to the defendant, if not paid in 6 months, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court finds the defendant did not make a good faith effort and extends probation for 6 months.

Court adjourned at 1:17 p.m.
Probation review hearing on May 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
2:27 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

ADA moves to amend 2013CF87 to 4th degree sexual assault in violation of 940.225(3m).  2014CF15 - moves to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping.  Attorney Haase concurs.  Defendant concurs.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  

Court goes over the two plea questionnaires with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of both offenses.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to both amended counts.  Court finds each plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on each count, as amended, and orders judgments of conviction be entered today.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Haase.  No statement by the defendant.

SWD, 24 months probation - both cases.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
2013CF87
NO contact with the victim.  Court instructs regarding forms of no contact.
Complete AODA and comply with any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Serve 30 days county jail - commence within 60 days - with huber.
Complete STD and HIV testing and the results submitted to the VW coordinator in a sealed envelope for forwarding to the victim.
Pay court costs.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.

2014CF15
CONDITIONS:
Complete AODA and comply with any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Pay court costs.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 2:40 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on April 1, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

10:36 a.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Attorney Haase indicates the defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the Court and provides a copy to Attorney Haase.  Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Haase indicates the defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.  Attorney Haase requests this case be tracked with 2013CF87 - Court so directs.

Court adjourned at 10:38 a.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

2:51 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail with Attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Attorney Mitchell confirms the defendant has received a copy of the complaint - waives reading - requests a preliminary hearing.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $1000.00 signature bond with the conditions of:  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.    Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Attorney Mitchell does not waive the time limits on the preliminary hearing.  Court directs Status Hearing to be held on March 3, 2014 at 10:00 a.m. and Preliminary Hearing to be held on March 4, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:54 p.m.
